page.title: 13MARKETS, LINCOLN.
page.content: Lincoln has always been a{market town and in the Middle Ages various markets were held in the walled town on the hillside, giving the name to many of the streets. In the 18th century the {Butter Market}was built but this began to fall to bits after 200 years so the {Cornhill Market Hall}was erected in 1935.This has been expanded today with the addition of a glass covered section. One part is owned by the{city {Corporation}and the other is{privately owned. The market sells virtually everything a shopper could want, fruit, vegetables, meat, fish, cheese, clothes , books and so on.Thousands of people from a wide area use the market each year. A famous American fast- food restaurant lures customers in.The square outside is often used for meetings, soap box preachers, street artists or just for having a breather.
